intro: Sisymbrium irioides, commonly known as sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium irioides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
